intro: Spathiostemon forbesii, commonly known as the Forbes' spathiflorous plant, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, spatulate flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or swampy areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
